ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] problems Installing cantera-1.5.2 on SGI Irix (Irix 6.5.6) w/gnu 3.2.2 compilers
ygData.msgSnippet: Brian, It is failing during build of the Cantera Python package, but it does not seem to be a Cantera problem.  It is complaining that some long double math

From: David Goodwin <dgoodwin@...>
Subject: Re: [cantera] problems Installing cantera-1.5.2 on SGI Irix (Irix 6.5.6) w/gnu 3.2.2 compilers
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=44728387
X-Yahoo-Profile: dggoodwin

Brian,

It is failing during build of the Cantera Python package, but it does  
not seem to be a Cantera problem.  It is complaining that some long  
double math functions have not been declared. These are not used by  
Cantera, If you look at file include/c++/cmath, you will see that the  
references to these funcions are surrounded by #ifdef statements like  
#ifdef _GLIBCPP_HAVE_ACOSL.  Somehow these are defined to be true on  
your system, when apparently you don't have these functions.

If you can tell me off-line (dgoodwin@...) where you had to  
tweak the Cantera build procedure to get it to compile on SGI, I can  
modify the build procedure.

Dave Goodwin


On Feb 4, 2004, at 12:04 PM, bmir50 wrote:

> Hi,
>
> I'm having major probs. installing "cantera", on an SGI origin 200
> (server class system) running SGI Irix 6.5.6 w/ gnu compilers, v.
> 3.3.2, gcc, g++, g77, and having "python" 2.3.3, w/ Numeric 2.3-1, and
> matlab 6.2.
>
> After a lot of "tweaking" (eliminating "ranlib" calls to various
> "makefiles) - the "gmake  OPT=" fails in the "build" Python phase.
>
> I'm trying to install it to an alternate directory
> (/usr/freeware/cantera/...   (from /usr/freeware/cantera-1.5.2 )
>
